body: Ok. What you're really describing is that what we call an index (which is some kind of a unique identifier for a dataset element; a key if you will), can really be used as some kind of a metadata that describes what kind of a batch should be returned from the dataset. That's fair, and I don't want to block this PR any further, but we might still want to think about the naming, because it's not really an index.
